intro: Ranunculus inamoenus f. elatior, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and showy, yellow to orange flowers. Native to the alpine regions of Europe, it thrives in cool, moist environments at high altitudes. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces small, hairy seed capsules. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens or alpine settings.
